math_6.subject: math
math_6.title: Grade 6 Math Diagnostic
math_6.description: Placement across ratios, percent, equations, geometry, and early data displays.

items.prompt: A recipe uses 3 cups of flour for 2 batches of muffins. How many cups are needed for 5 batches?
A bus travels 180 miles in 3 hours. What is its unit rate in miles per hour?
A $50 jacket is on sale for 10% off. What is the sale price before tax?

The table shows a proportional relationship between x and y. If x = 4, what is y?
(x, y): (1, 2.5), (2, 5), (3, 7.5), (4, ?)
Four tickets to a museum cost $18. Using a double-number-line idea, how much would 10 tickets cost at the same rate?
A bag has red and white marbles in a ratio of 3:2. If there are 25 marbles total, how many are red?
Which number has the greatest value?
What is the value of -4 - 7?
Solve for x: x + 5 = 17
Solve for x: 3x = 21
Which value of p does NOT make the inequality p - 4 \u2264 9 true?
Which expression matches the phrase "five less than triple a number n"?
Point P is at (-3, 4) on the coordinate plane. Which quadrant contains P?
A rectangular prism measures 5 cm by 3 cm by 2 cm. What is its volume?
In a right triangle, the legs are 6 units and 8 units. What is the length of the hypotenuse?
A shape moves 4 units to the left on the coordinate plane without turning. Which transformation is this?
Which sample would best estimate how students feel about cafeteria lunches?

options.text: Surveying 50 students chosen at random across grades
Asking students in one lunch line

items.prompt: A scatterplot shows that as study time increases, test scores also increase. What kind of association is this?
If a spinner has 3 green sections and 1 red section of equal size, what is the probability of landing on green?
When rolling a standard six-sided die, what is the probability of getting an even number?

math_7.subject: math
math_7.title: Grade 7 Math Diagnostic
math_7.description: Checks proportional reasoning, rational operations, two-step equations, geometry, and data foundations.

items.prompt:
The table represents a proportional relationship. What is the constant of proportionality (unit rate)?
(x, y): (1, 2), (2, 4), (5, 10)
Five notebooks cost $12.50. At the same rate, how much do 8 notebooks cost?
A graph of a proportional relationship passes through the point (2, 6). What is its equation?
A $60 jacket is discounted by 15%. What is the sale price?
A bike costs $80 and sales tax is 7%. What is the total cost?
On a map, 1 cm represents 4 meters. A path measures 7.5 cm on the map. What is the actual length?
What is -5 + (-7)?
What is 2/3 divided by 1/6?
Solve for x: 4x - 7 = 25
Solve for x: 2(x + 3) = 18
Solve for p: 5 + 3p > 17
Maria spent $12 on lunch and bought 3 identical shirts. She spent $120 in total. Which equation finds the price p of each shirt?
A blueprint uses a scale of 1 inch to 4 feet. If a wall is 6 inches long on the blueprint, how long is it in reality?
What is the surface area of a cube with side length 3 cm?
A right triangle has a hypotenuse of 15 feet and one leg of 9 feet. How long is the other leg?
Find the slope between the points (1, 2) and (4, 8).
Which is the best way to estimate the percentage of students who prefer music during lunch?

options.text: Ask students in one lunch line

items.prompt: You flip a fair coin and roll a fair six-sided die. What is the probability of getting heads and rolling a number greater than 4?
A bag has 4 blue and 6 green marbles. What is the probability of randomly picking a blue marble, then a green marble without replacement?

math_8.subject: math
math_8.title: Grade 8 Math Diagnostic
math_8.description: Gauges readiness for linear functions, systems, Pythagorean reasoning, and grade-band data.

items.prompt: Find the slope between the points (3, 7) and (5, 11).
Which equation represents a line with slope 3 and y-intercept -1?
A table shows x: 0, 2, 4 and y: -3, 3, 9. What is the rate of change?
Is the relation {(1,2), (1,3), (2,4)} a function?

options.text: Yes, each x has exactly one y
No, x = 1 has two different y values

items.prompt: For the function y = 0.8x + 2, what is y when x = 5?
A quantity increases from 50 to 65. What is the percent increase?
Solve the system: y = 2x + 1 and y = -x + 10.
Solve the system: 3x - y = 5 and x + y = 7.
Plan A costs $20 plus $3 per gig of data. Plan B costs $5 plus $5 per gig. At how many gigs do the plans cost the same?
In a right triangle with legs 9 and 12, what is the length of the hypotenuse?
What is the distance between the points (1, 2) and (5, 9)?
Turning a figure 90 degrees around the origin is which transformation?
What is the volume of a cylinder with radius 3 units and height 4 units?
Two similar triangles have a scale factor of 1.5. If a side on the smaller triangle is 8 cm, what is the corresponding side on the larger triangle?
A line of best fit for a scatterplot of study hours vs. test scores has a slope of 2. What does this mean?

options.text: Scores drop by 2 points per study hour
Scores rise about 2 points per study hour

items.prompt: In a survey of 50 students, 30 preferred fiction. What is the relative frequency of students who preferred fiction?
What is the probability of drawing a red card from a standard deck (26 red cards) and rolling an even number on a fair die?
Write 0.00032 in scientific notation.
Evaluate (-4)^2 / 8.
A prediction was 48 students, but the actual count was 50. What is the percent error?

ela_6.subject: ela
ela_6.title: Grade 6 ELA Diagnostic
ela_6.description: Evidence use, informational analysis, argument writing, vocabulary, and discussion skills.

items.prompt: Maya checked the weather, packed a raincoat, and caught the early bus because the clouds were dark. Which detail best supports the inference that Maya was prepared?

options.text: She hoped it would rain later
She packed a raincoat before leaving

items.prompt: In a story, Jonas keeps rebuilding his tower after it falls several times. Which theme does this best show?
A narrator says, "I couldn't believe Sara volunteered first," while another character smiles and raises her hand. What does this reveal about Sara?

options.text: She is shy and avoids attention
She is confident about speaking up

items.prompt: Which sentence is the strongest evidence that a character feels nervous about a performance?

options.text: Her hands trembled as she stepped on stage.
The lights were bright and warm.
She waved to her family in the crowd.

items.prompt: A paragraph explains how recycling reduces landfill waste and conserves resources. Which sentence best states the main idea?

options.text: Recycling keeps materials out of landfills and saves resources
People should throw away less food

items.prompt: An article compares wind power and solar power, listing pros and cons for each. What text structure is the author using?
Which sentence best supports the claim that school gardens help students learn science?

options.text: The garden looks beautiful in spring
Students measure plant growth and graph the results
Tomatoes are the most popular plant

items.prompt: An author presents a problem of litter in parks and proposes cleanup days as a solution. What is the author's purpose?

options.text: To entertain readers with a story
To explain why parks close early
To persuade readers to join cleanup efforts

items.prompt: Which is the strongest claim for an argument about school lunches?

options.text: Our school should offer more fresh fruits to improve student health

items.prompt: Which evidence best supports the claim that more recess improves focus?

options.text: A study showed test scores rose after schools added recess time

items.prompt: Which transition best connects two reasons in an argument?
How should a concluding statement support a claim?

options.text: By restating the claim and why it matters
By repeating the introduction word for word

items.prompt: In the sentence "Carlos was reluctant to join the game," what does "reluctant" mean?
The root "tele" in "telegraph" means:
Which word best replaces "helped" to add precision? "The volunteer helped the new student find her classes."
During a multimedia presentation, what is the best way to take notes?

options.text: Copy every sentence on the slides
Write key ideas and examples in your own words

items.prompt: If you disagree with a peer in a discussion, what is the best response?

options.text: Interrupt to say they are wrong
Listen, then share your evidence politely

items.prompt: Which question shows active listening to a speaker about ocean pollution?

options.text: Why does plastic harm sea animals?

ela_7.subject: ela
ela_7.title: Grade 7 ELA Diagnostic
ela_7.description: Evaluates evidence in texts, argument quality, academic vocabulary, and collaborative discussion.

items.prompt: A narrator notes, "Lena rehearsed her speech twice before raising her hand to present." Which evidence best shows Lena's motivation?

options.text: She rehearsed because she wanted to do well.
She rehearsed because she was bored.
She rehearsed because her friend told her to.
She rehearsed because she forgot the topic.

items.prompt: Which detail best supports the theme that honesty strengthens friendships?

options.text: After telling the truth, Maya's friend thanked her for being direct.
They decided to meet again on Saturday.
Maya bought her friend a snack.

items.prompt: If a narrator admits, "I might be remembering this wrong," what does that suggest?

options.text: The narrator's account may be biased or uncertain

items.prompt: Which sentence offers the best text evidence that a character is feeling left out?

options.text: He watched the others from the hallway, clutching his books.

items.prompt: An article claims that school uniforms reduce morning stress. Which evidence best strengthens this claim?

options.text: A survey found students spent 10 fewer minutes choosing clothes after uniforms were introduced

items.prompt: Which statement shows a flaw in reasoning in an argument about homework?

options.text: "Homework is useless because I dislike it."
"Homework should match what we learned in class."
"Homework can be done online or on paper."

items.prompt: An author cites a blog post without data to prove a medical claim. What should the reader question?

options.text: Whether the source is credible and supported by evidence

items.prompt: Which sentence most clearly states an author's claim about screen time?

options.text: Many teens use tablets for homework.
Limiting screen time before bed improves sleep quality.

items.prompt: Which is the strongest claim for an argument about later school start times?

options.text: Schools should start later because research links more sleep to higher grades and safer commutes

items.prompt: Which sentence works as a counterclaim in an essay supporting longer lunches?

options.text: Some argue longer lunches could reduce class time.

items.prompt: Which transition best shows contrast between two reasons?
What should a concluding statement do in a Grade 7 argument?

options.text: Acknowledge counterclaims and reinforce the main claim

items.prompt: In "The activist chose to advocate for clean air laws," what does "advocate" mean?

options.text: To speak or act in favor of

items.prompt: The root "inter" in "international" means:
Which word best replaces "said" to show a writer presented reasons clearly?
During a debate, which question best probes a speaker's evidence?

options.text: Where did you find that data?

items.prompt: If you disagree during discussion, what should you do first?

options.text: Listen fully, then cite evidence for your view

items.prompt: What is an effective note to capture while listening to a persuasive speech?

options.text: Key claims and the evidence cited
Whether the slides use blue or green

ela_8.subject: ela
ela_8.title: Grade 8 ELA Diagnostic
ela_8.description: Checks evidence use, evaluation of claims and counterclaims, precise language, and academic discourse.

items.prompt: A character stays late to fix a project despite missing a game. Which evidence best supports the inference that responsibility matters to them?

options.text: They didn't want to get in trouble.
They choose the project over the game because others are counting on them.

items.prompt: Which detail best shows a narrator's tone is skeptical?

options.text: She accepted the plan without a thought.
She raised an eyebrow and asked, "Are you sure this will work?"
She cheered loudly at the idea.

items.prompt: If a story is told from a first-person point of view, what should readers keep in mind about the events?

options.text: They may reflect the narrator's bias or limited knowledge.

items.prompt: Which sentence best supports the theme that setbacks can lead to growth?

options.text: After failing, he analyzed his mistakes and tried a new approach.

items.prompt: A writer claims that year-round school improves learning and cites a travel blog as evidence. What weakens this argument most?

options.text: The claim is unrelated to travel, making the source questionable.

items.prompt: Which sentence best refutes a counterclaim that school arts programs are unnecessary?

options.text: Studies link arts participation to higher graduation rates.

items.prompt: Which reasoning is flawed in an argument about banning phones?

options.text: "No schools allow phones, so ours shouldn't either" (without evidence)

items.prompt: An article includes a statistic about water use but doesn't cite the source. What should readers do?

options.text: Accept it because it seems true
Question the statistic until a reliable source is provided

items.prompt: Which claim best sets up an argument and acknowledges a counterclaim?

options.text: While some worry about cost, investing in healthier cafeteria options benefits student focus and wellbeing.

items.prompt: Which sentence effectively introduces a counterclaim about homework?

options.text: Some argue that homework teaches responsibility, even though excessive amounts can backfire.

items.prompt: Which transition best signals a rebuttal to a counterclaim?
What should a conclusion include in a Grade 8 argument essay?

options.text: A summary that revisits the claim and shows how evidence answered counterclaims

items.prompt: In "New rules aim to mitigate traffic near the school," mitigate most nearly means:
The root "cred" in "credible" means:
Which word best replaces "said angrily" to add precision?
During a seminar, which follow-up question best challenges a statistic a speaker cited?

options.text: Where was that statistic published, and when?

items.prompt: What is an effective first step before rebutting a peer's claim?
What is the best note to capture when listening to a talk for later citation?

options.text: Source titles and key quotes with time stamps
